promptAnswer: 80 y/o male from nursing home in respiratory distress, EMS reports sat was 70% on arrival, comes up to 100% on NRB.
q4Answer: Pmhx = HTN, stage IV lung CA, COPD, CHF
q5Answer: PE: thin, mildly diaphoretic, tachycardic, increased WOB w bibasilar rales and diffuse wheezing, +1 pitting edema bilat

promptAnswer: 25 y/o male with high fever and lethargy at home. Tachy and warm, drowsy but talks.
q5Answer: PE: warm to touch, breathing comfortably, tachycardic, bilateral breath sounds, follows commands/moves all 4 ext

promptAnswer: 30 y/o female with difficulty breathing x 5 days, using accessory muscles, sats 80s on NRB. Pt is 32 weeks pregnant.
q2Answer: EKG = sinus tachycardia w TWI in V2 and lead III
q5Answer: PE: distressed, increased work of breathing with use of accessory muscles, diaphoretic, lethargic, abdomen gravid and non tender

promptAnswer: 75 y/o female who was found unresponsive at home, lives with family- everybody has a respiratory illness. RR 40s, sat 92% on room air.
q5Answer: PE:  moans in response to pain, otherwise unresponsive. Pale, tachycardic, shallow respirations with poor air movement, cool extremities
